com.zberman2.DataManager

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zberman2.DataManager.Board
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    StandardBoard

    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Class describing the functionality of a chess board Created by Zack Berman on 9/10/2014.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Constructor which accepts an ArrayList of pieces
      Board(int xDimension, int yDimension, int numSides)
      Blank constructor

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Piece at(char file, int rank)
      Method which iterates through the list of pieces and determines if there is a piece at (x, y) on the board.
      void drawBoard()
      Creates a new GUI object and displays a chessboard GUI
      int getNumSides()
      Getter for number of sides of the board (not used, but may be useful if game is changed from a standard square board to something else)
      java.util.ArrayList<Piece> getPieces()
      Getter for pieces
      int getxDimension()
      Getter for x dimension of the board
      int getyDimension()
      Getter for y dimension of the board
      boolean isOpenDiagonalPath(char newFile, int newRank, Piece piece)
      Given a diagonal path, this method determines if there are any pieces located between the Piece's current position and its destination, (newFile, newRank)
      boolean isOpenHorizontalPath(char newFile, int newRank, Piece piece)
      Given a horizontal path, this method determines if there are any pieces located between the Piece's current position and its destination, (a, b)
      boolean isOpenVerticalPath(char newFile, int newRank, Piece piece)
      Given a vertical path, this method determines if there are any pieces located between the Piece's current position and its destination, (a, b)
      void printBoard()
      Prints terminal window chess board
      void setPieces(java.util.ArrayList<Piece> pieces)
      Setter for the ArrayList of pieces.

    • Method Detail

      • setPieces

        public void setPieces(java.util.ArrayList<Piece> pieces)
        Setter for the ArrayList of pieces. Used with the blank constructor to construct a blank board, and later add the pieces.
        Parameters:
        pieces - ArrayList of initial chess pieces to be placed on the board

      • getPieces

        public java.util.ArrayList<Piece> getPieces()
        Getter for pieces
        Returns:
        ArrayList of pieces on the board

        Getter for x dimension of the board
        Returns:
        xDimension

      • getNumSides

        public int getNumSides()
        Getter for number of sides of the board (not used, but may be useful if game is changed from a standard square board to something else)
        Returns:
        number of sides on the chess board

      • at

        public Piece at(char file,
                int rank)
        Method which iterates through the list of pieces and determines if there is a piece at (x, y) on the board. If there is, it returns that piece, null otherwise.
        Parameters:
        file - file coordinate
        rank - rank coordinate
        Returns:
        The piece at (file, rank), null if one doesn't exist

      • isOpenDiagonalPath

        public boolean isOpenDiagonalPath(char newFile,
                                  int newRank,
                                  Piece piece)
        Given a diagonal path, this method determines if there are any pieces located between the Piece's current position and its destination, (newFile, newRank)
        Parameters:
        newFile - file coordinate of new space
        newRank - rank coordinate of new space
        piece - reference to the piece trying to move
        Returns:
        true if there are no Pieces in the way

      • isOpenVerticalPath

        public boolean isOpenVerticalPath(char newFile,
                                  int newRank,
                                  Piece piece)
        Given a vertical path, this method determines if there are any pieces located between the Piece's current position and its destination, (a, b)
        Parameters:
        newFile - file coordinate of new space
        newRank - rank coordinate of new space
        piece - reference to the piece trying to move
        Returns:
        true if there are no Pieces in the way

      • isOpenHorizontalPath

        public boolean isOpenHorizontalPath(char newFile,
                                    int newRank,
                                    Piece piece)
        Given a horizontal path, this method determines if there are any pieces located between the Piece's current position and its destination, (a, b)
        Parameters:
        newFile - file coordinate of new space
        newRank - rank coordinate of new space
        piece - reference to the piece trying to move
        Returns:
        true if there are no Pieces in the way
